poem:
Title: Ballad of the Silent Boys

In the noiseless catacomb of distant rooms,
Boys huddle, their solitude a stone curse,
Young Atlas, burdened by unseen viral blooms, 
Offered in sacrifice upon Covid's harsh hearse. 
Their laughter, once loud and bold,
But muted echoes in the cold. 
Will these dislocated sons of ours,
Close-trapped, wilted, bemoaning lost hours,
Find manhood's strength in these surreal towers?
